intro: Icacorea popayanensis, commonly known as the Popayán icacure, is a flowering plant native to Colombia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
